The osmotic potential was determined by opting for the procedure of Capell and Doerffling
48 . Leaves from each treatment were placed in a 3 ml plastic syringe and stored at − 20 °C freezer. After a few days, when the leaves became frozen, these syringes were taken out and pressed to collect the leaf sap from the thawed samples in Eppendorf tubes.
